pull.title: ci: Ignore internal errors of snapshot compilers
pull.body: It was discussed on today's IRC meeting.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.body: Concept ACK, thanks for the quick response
ACK mod nit and CI results

Real failures are still reported as real failures:
 https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/actions/runs/6791773753/job/18463903460?pr=1440

But for some of them, `CC` is not set (and we let configure detect the right `CC`)
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/actions/runs/6791773753/job/18463894482?pr=1440#step:3:780

Perhaps just add a default substitution in case CC is not set. This should be good enough. The snapshots are only used if we ask for them explicitly by setting CC. We could also read `CC` from the `CC=` line in config.log, but that sounds like overkill.

verification.payload:
tree dcfc02260aa3204dbadaf1ff1bec6e874953595c
parent 1f1bb78b7fc2060d06df170d76d08511b077cfe7
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1699358757 +0000
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1699465912 +0000

ci: Ignore internal errors in snapshot compilers

events.message: ci: Ignore internal errors in snapshot compilers

events.body:
> But for some of them, `CC` is not set...

Solved by using the same approach as used in other places of the `ci.sh` script.

ACK 8185e72d299bc77de9c06cc92fd1988676df3bc1

See https://github.com/real-or-random/secp256k1/actions/runs/6802798679/job/18496698030 for a real build failure on top of this PR
Merging this, we shouldn't hold this up because a broken CI is very annoying.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -83,7 +83,19 @@ esac
     --host="$HOST" $EXTRAFLAGS
 
 # We have set "-j<n>" in MAKEFLAGS.
-make
+build_exit_code=0
+make || build_exit_code=$?
comments.body:
nit: This should be simpler
```suggestion
make
build_exit_code=$?
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -83,7 +83,19 @@ esac
     --host="$HOST" $EXTRAFLAGS
 
 # We have set "-j<n>" in MAKEFLAGS.
-make
+build_exit_code=0
+make || build_exit_code=$?
+if [ $build_exit_code -ne 0 ]; then
+    case $CC in
+        *snapshot*)
+            make 2>&1 >/dev/null | grep "internal compiler error:"
comments.body:
Regarding `make 2>&1 >/dev/null`:

I think it would be more reliable to run `make` only once. (Perhaps gcc-snapshot crashes in one run but not in another.)

One way could be: Change the first `make` to `make | tee make.log` and then use `grep` on `make.log`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -83,7 +83,19 @@ esac
     --host="$HOST" $EXTRAFLAGS
 
 # We have set "-j<n>" in MAKEFLAGS.
-make
+build_exit_code=0
+make || build_exit_code=$?
+if [ $build_exit_code -ne 0 ]; then
+    case $CC in
+        *snapshot*)
+            make 2>&1 >/dev/null | grep "internal compiler error:"
comments.body:
Regarding `grep "internal compiler error:"`:

Could also additionally grep for "PLEASE submit a bug report". This is what clang will output when it crashes.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -83,7 +83,19 @@ esac
     --host="$HOST" $EXTRAFLAGS
 
 # We have set "-j<n>" in MAKEFLAGS.
-make
+build_exit_code=0
+make || build_exit_code=$?
comments.body:
> nit: This should be simpler

Doesn't `set -eux` in the top of the script force exiting when `make` fails?

@@ -83,7 +83,20 @@ esac
     --host="$HOST" $EXTRAFLAGS
 
 # We have set "-j<n>" in MAKEFLAGS.
-make
+build_exit_code=0
+make > make.log 2>&1 || build_exit_code=$?
+cat make.log
+if [ $build_exit_code -ne 0 ]; then
+    case $CC in
+        *snapshot*)
+            grep -e "internal compiler error:" -e "PLEASE submit a bug report" make.log
comments.body:
nit:
```suggestion
            # Ignore internal compiler errors in gcc-snapshot and clang-snapshot
            grep -e "internal compiler error:" -e "PLEASE submit a bug report" make.log
```
